inn1.comm: on the pads and Cook has a 100% strike rate to launch his ODI captaincy era. That's a 29% improvement on his previous mark ...
low full toss, poked cautiously out to point from deep in the crease
back of a length, but arrow straight. Defended to the leg side
on off stump, defended out to point once again. Good pace so far, and a defiantly straight bat from Kieswetter
pushed firmly into the gap at cover, and Kieswetter scampers through
that's the way to do it! A leg-stump half-volley, and Cook eases it insouciently through midwicket. He's been doing that in Test cricket for 10 months solid now
outside off stump, a hint of nibble off the juiced-up wicket. Left alone
big stride forward, and defended hard back down the pitch
outside off, no stroke offered
there's that issue against the moving ball that found Kieswetter out last year. Tailing in late, and a hard-handed jab takes a leading edge towards cover.
punched to cover
squared up a touch by an inswinger, and that's an excellent maiden to open his account
Cook's gone! An innocuous delivery, tailing down the leg-side, Cook goes for the leg glance but gets nothing more than a feather through to the keeper
outside off, nibbling away, defended out to cover
full and straight again, defended out to cover with a leather-sniffing forward defensive
bouncer, but it's a no-ball, and a front-foot no-ball at that. It's free hit time
top shot from Trott. Malinga flung the delivery out wide,  but it was met with the full face of a flat bat, and steered through the covers
clipped off the hip to square leg
slower delivery, and flicked through midwicket. Top work
clunked out to cover, and a quick single ensues. Just about home safe, though a direct hit would have been tight.
outside off, no stroke offered
punched into the covers off the back foot. No real timing in the shot
left alone with a big raise of the bat. Two fours in quick succession is quite enough momentum-seizing for now
and off he goes again. On the pads, an easy-as-you-like flick off the hip, reminiscent of his Ashes-seizing century at the MCG. The runs keep coming
tucked into the leg side once again
speared down the leg side
flicked into the leg side, Kieswetter joins the party
forward, and blocked firmly back down the track. A loud "no!" to emphasise the point
another loose delivery down the leg side. Not an auspicious start for Lakmal
fuller and straighter, a bit of a mistimed smear from Kieswetter
blocked back down the track
flicked off the toes. A calmer approach is reaping some dividends so far
full length, swinging into the toes, a drive squirts to midwicket but they run a good single
full face, driven to mid-off
dabbed down to gully
that's a better shot, his best of the day so far. A full stride, a straight bat, and punched clean through the covers
forward again, and defended into the gap
full and straight, and a fat inside-edge saves Trott from an lbw appeal
blocked out to point, Kieswetter continues to take the slow and steady approach
firmly forward, and defended again
nudged down to third man for a single
a nudged defence once again
on the pads, but this time Trott's timing is off. That one climbed on him a touch
nudged to midwicket
just a single from a very tight and tidy over. A much better effort
Kulasekara's first ball after a long break is bang on the mark, heading for off and Kieswetter is full of defence
neatly played, Kieswetter edging down the wicket and steering a rising delivery wide of point
Trott defends carefully his first ball, as he's entitled to
smart fielding at point denies Trott runs as he edges down the crease to drive square
Sangakkara is up to the stumps in response to all the footwork so Kieswetter drives from the crease through cover
with a hint of inside edge Trott has managed to squeeze this off his pads very fine, past the short fine leg fielder for four
nicely done from Kieswetter here, got the length ball he wanted and swung handsomely through the line, pinging it over long-on for six
Lakmal's response is a good one - yorker - that the batsman jabs to mid-off
Trott is squared up a fraction as he defends this
Trott this time finds the boundary, in style too. Jumping outside leg stump to open up the off side and flaying it through extra cover
some dandy footwork from Trott, faking a move to outside leg before staying where he is. The bowler is not moved and lands a good yorker
gone this time! Top work from Lakmal, full, straight, and clumping Trott on the toe as he played around his pad
poor delivery and Kieswetter latches onto it. Sliding down the leg side and he helps it to the boundary with a sweetly-timed flip to deep square
Kulasekara finds a better line and length that Kieswetter can only bunt to mid-on. Brings Pietersen onto strike, which is always exciting
nip back from a good length, prodded to leg
with fine leg up in the circle, sliding onto the pads is no place to bowl. Pietersen is away with a fine flick past the man
sliced drive to cover this time
good finish to an expensive over. Kulasekara hitting a length and line, finding solid defence. Ends a good Powerplay for England
starts with a slower ball that Kieswetter tries, and fails, to work to leg
ooh, from slower ball to sharp bouncer in two deliveries. Rushed Kieswetter on the pull and it looped up over the midwicket for a couple
back to the slower ball this time, the line was awry though and Kieswetter whipped a single off his pads
sharp yorker, really top delivery from that low angle. Pietersen managed to clamp down just in time
another yorker, perfectly landed. Pietersen jabs back down the ground and as he completes the single exchanges a laugh with Malinga
such good work from Malinga, so difficult to get those yorkers away

Dilshan is electric at mid-off and he's nailed Pietersen here, surely? No! Pietersen drove hard to mid-off and sprinted off for a single, he's seriously quick but Dilshan's throw hit direct. It looks like as he dives in the bat is in the air but it's a split-frame job... and the umpire has ruled with the doubt. Tough call that
Kieswetter is doing his favourite trick of running miles outside leg, in the end he went so far he could only just about toe-end this full-toss and managed to jab it over point
full and straight from the bowler, Pietersen very certain in defence
Pietersen gallops down the crease to make this into a full-toss but can't time the drive
this reaches Kieswetter on the full and he slugs to deep midwicket
stinging blow to Dilshan at mid-off as Kieswetter hammers a drive. Hit it so hard he couldn't even rush one.
bursting away from Pietersen on that slingy angle, KP sets himself deep in his crease and nudges to leg but can't quite get it away, just the single
slower-ball bouncer from Malinga, but it's spotted and paddled to fine leg
speared at the toes, the length is not quite right though and it's slammed down to long on
another slower ball, this one a low, dipping full toss. I'm not sure Kieswetter picked that one, but he managed to get bat on ball
rare in-between length from Malinga, neither full nor short and sitting up nicely for Pietersen to heave to wide long-on
that's more like it. Malinga fires one at the base of off stump and Pietersen can only dig it out to mid-off
Sanath comes round the stumps and lobs one down on middle and leg, driven to mid-off
Pietersen hangs back and nudges to long on for an easy single
Kieswetter jumps out and swipes down to long-on, not timed but the intent was clear
flicked into the leg side, midwicket dives but can only parry the ball and they trot through for a single
again the fielding is not quite watertight, this time it's mid-off who does enough to get to the ball but can't stop it cleanly. That was driven hard though
swept to fine leg! There's a short boundary down there and he's picked it out perfectly
he comes round the wicket to the right-hander, as he did in the Twenty20, but there's plenty of room in the leg side and KP picks up to with a glance to midwicket
strong shot! Pietersen came confidently out of his crease and got right to the pitch, slamming the ball straight back down the ground
punched hard to to long-on off the front foot
Kieswetter steps forward to drive, sending the ball rolling out to long-off
Pietersen attempts to repeat his stroke from earlier in the over, but doesn't quite middle it and long-on sprints round to cut it off
Kieswetter gets to fifty in style! He skipped down and swung mightily, for a moment it looked like he had more height than distance in the shot but the ball just kept on going
pushed out to wide long-off for a single
Kieswetter follows suit, off the front foot this time
a little too short from Jayasuriya, but the ball doesn't really get up and KP has to jab down at it. Still, gets enough of a connection to pick up a single
driven down to long-off
KP drives powerfully down the ground ... or does he? Kieswetter hopped to let the ball through his legs but left his bat grounded, the ball rebounded off the bat and stopped the run
driven hard down to long-off for another single

and he's got him with his first ball! Terrible ball, a rank long-hop, but KP leaned back and pulled straight into the hands of Dilshan at midwicket, and Sri Lanka are delighted. The batsmen had started to tick along quite nicely, and this will ease Sri Lanka's nerves ... although, now they'll have Eoin Morgan to deal with
was this the wrong 'un? Definitely didn't come back in to Morgan as he lunged out in defence
immediately the reverse sweep is in use, but he picks out short third man

almost another wicket! It was another filthy long-hop, Morgan tried to smack it out of the park but looked to have picked out Mathew at deep midwicket ... the fielder couldn't quite judge the catch though, coming forward and then stopping and ultimately diving forward in vain as the ball bounced in front of him. Close!
driven to cover
slapped hard to the cover boundary! The bottom hand powers Morgan's drive, but his power and placement are perfect
a rare deft touch from the bat of Craig Kieswetter as he waits until the very last moment and glides a late cut down to the third man boundary
chopped down to backward point
Jayasuriya targets the pads, and Kieswetter tucks him to leg for a single
and now Morgan targets the third man boundary, slicing a late cut down to that region. Some tag-team fielding by the rope ensures there's no boundary
driven hard to Jayasuriya's left, he creaks across but can't get there in time
a touch of width offered, Morgan stays back and bends his knees to cut to deep backward point
full on off stump, driven to long-off
there's a man at short third man to stop Morgan's reverse sweep, but this has sailed right over his head! Deliberately hit in the air by Morgan, great technique
Mendis is all over the place here, attempting another googly but it bounces halfway down the track and is smashed to deep midwicket
flat on off stump, Morgan gives himself room but toe-ends the cut
a controlled chip is aimed towards long-off, bouncing well in front of the fielder
fired full and fast at Kieswetter's toes. His bat is late in coming down but he keeps it out
he starts with a slower ball - it looked like an offcutter - that Morgan taps to long-off
he was probably aiming for the yorker here, but it slips out as quite a high full toss that Kieswetter swings to midwicket
another full toss - this one low and dipping towards the toes - but Morgan just flicks his wrists at the ball to send it rocketing out to deep square, with one bounce before reaching the fielder
another full toss, and this one is slammed to long-off
Lakmal forgets about the yorker plan and instead hits a good length on off stump. Morgan defends.
full and fast on the toes, real pinpoint stuff. Morgan can't lay bat on it, and there's an appeal, but that was definitely going well down the leg side

a slog-sweep, a top-edge, and a simple catch for short third man, running in. Lakmal - who didn't have the best time in the field during the Tests - is all smiles after holding onto that. England are scoring at a decent lick, but these wickets will keep Sri Lanka in the game
flat and fast, Morgan steps back and nudges to midwicket
this time Bell stays put, pushing to off
flicked into the leg side, and they take a quick single and Morgan's back on strike
and Morgan returns the favour, tapping to midwicket for one
the shot of a man in sublime form. Bell came forward then hopped back, cracking a cut right out of the middle of the bat to send the ball rolling away behind square
he's full and straight to start, and Morgan just watchfully lays bat on ball
full again, this time Morgan drives down the ground to bring up England's 150
Kulasekara nibbles one back in to Bell, the ball coming off the inner half of the bat and going to leg
this looked like a slower one, and a good one it is as Morgan can't get it away
width offered outside off, but Morgan's cut goes straight to point
full on off stump, Morgan opens his wrists into the drive to pick the gap in front of point and picks up a single
he's full and fast to start, Morgan digging the ball out into the off side
Malinga finds the edge of Bell's bat! But it's with one of his canny slower balls, and so the edge drops well short of Sangakkara
great follow-up, a searingly quick yorker that takes the bottom edge and flies to fine leg

again the edge! But has Morgan hit this into the ground? Has he hit it at all? There's a huge appeal from keeper and bowler, but Umpire Illingworth says no. And rightfully so, he hit that straight into the ground
sharp yorker, and Morgan does well just to keep it out
a low full toss, quite wide outside off, is cracked into the covers for a single
not a great start, a long-hop fired down the leg side and the ball rebounds off Morgan's like as he tries to smash it away ... ah, and great work by Jeevan Mendis down at fine leg saves the boundary
Randiv comes round the wicket to Bell, giving him no room to work with. Tapped back to the bowler
Bell turns round into a reverse sweep as Randiv approaches, he receives a full toss but it's clipped to short third man/short fine leg
another full toss, this time to Morgan who had jumped out of his crease and proceeded to smash it to wide long-off
Morgan is using his feet so well. The ball before he danced out, this time he stays really deep and cuts behind square for yet another boundary
flat on middle and leg, Morgan shovels to leg for a single
long-hop to start, but the ball doesn't bounce much and Morgan has to jab down at it ... but still picks up two to midwicket
fired at the pads from round the wicket, Morgan glances to the right of fine leg and sprints back for two more
bunted down to long-on for one
this one is really flighted up by Jayasuriya, and Bell's drive is stopped by Dilshan at cover
driven again by Bell, this time it's in the air but wide of a diving Dilshan. There's cover out in the deep
slapped out to deep cover off the back foot

Lakmal's slower ball does for Morgan. Picked it too late but went through with a lofted drive, only succeeded in lifting it to long-off. Ends a dazzling little innings and a crucial strike for Sri Lanka
fired full but down the leg side by Lakmal
very full this time, reaching Bell about waist-high, Bell blocks and looks around to the square leg umpire looking for a no ball but it was marginal
good, straight line from Lakmal leaving Bell nowhere to go
poor fielding turns one into a two, Kandamby running to, and straight past, the ball from long-on
ah Bell has missed out here and he knows it. Full toss heading down the leg side but he couldn't get it away
another full toss, the line though is straight, and all Bell can do is bunt a single down the ground

Bell goes now! England stuttering. Jayasuriya celebrates and it was good bowling, took the pace off the ball and Bell shuffled around the crease before getting down to sweep. Missed it and was struck plumb in front
Broad is very careful in defence first delivery. Both batsmen on zero so there'll be no great charge in the closing overs
Broad often chips in the air in this area - midwicket - just lifting it off his pads
Bresnan gets deep into his crease to clunk one straight down the ground where Jeevan Mendis does well to save after slipping terribly and ending up in a heap
this time it's pushed into space for a sharp single
Broad digs out a low-slung yorker to end a good over for Sri Lanka
Bresnan hangs back and waits on this before poking to the off side
the demon lack of spin does for Bresnan on the outside edge
flat, back of a length offspin from around the wicket it proving hard to get away. Bresnan nudges a single to leg
no leverage for Broad to work with and he can only push back to the bowler
unable to drive down the ground Broad instead reverts to a fine sweep shot but only earns him one
swing and miss outside off. These darts are just sliding off the pitch and Bresnan is unable to get hold of it
really short ball, wide too, but Broad's cut finds deep point. The boundaries have dried up
Bresnan shimmies down before clumping along the ground to long-off
wide arrowed down the leg side
Broad tries to heave a sweep from outside off but can't time it
another wide sliding down the leg side
the lack of timing on this off-side slap allows Broad to get a couple out to deep cover
driven hard  back at the bowler, who couldn't collect cleanly, and ended up directing it wide of the fielder running in from mid-off and allowing Broad a second
heaved into the leg side, without timing or power
how do you play that!? Low-slung, perfectly-placed yorker. Reversing away too. Broad prodded and missed
again Broad has no clue, but you can't blame him really. This is a low full toss but swings away late and finds an outside edge that rushes to point
Bresnan's turn this time to play and miss at a Malinga yorker. Swings in late towards the toes but passes through to the keeper. England scramble a bye
that will do nicely for England! Malinga just gets his line a fraction wrong and it flicks the pads and speeds down, past short fine leg, to the boundary
Malinga is back on the right line this time and Broad prods a single to Dilshan at short midwicket. Dilshan rarely misses and it's lucky for Broad he did
suddenly it's a good over for England. Malinga gets his length and line wrong and Bresnan swings a leg-side full toss to the square leg boundary
high full toss outside off stump is sliced to third man
oh dear, Lakmal has got this all wrong. Very full but miles down the leg side. England back in business now
four more! Bresnan's heave to cow corner pays off. Not a great delivery, Lakmal is under pressure here
and another! Horrid luck for the bowler this time. Another full toss, Bresnan was aiming cow corner but found an inside edge that bounced close to the stumps and down to the fine leg rope
and another! Bresnan is having a dream return for England! Lakmal unable to hit the pitch and Bresnan just eases his arms through it, pinging it down to deep square
finally some relief for Lakmal and Sri Lanka. Bresnan hit it hard but straight to deep cover
another full toss, pressure is a horrible thing, fortunately for the bowler Broad couldn't take full toll and swung it to deep cover
Malinga finds an ideal outswinging yorker past Broad's blade but the batsman hurry through for a bye

gone this time! Bresnan tried to walk across his stumps and dink Malinga round the corner. He missed, it struck his back leg. It looked plumb on first viewing but replays showed it heading a long way down leg. Crucial little cameo though from Bresnan
Swann prods a defence back to the bowler, Broad heads down for a single and all Malinga had to do with hit the stumps from 10 metres away, but somehow he missed and England got the run
very careful drive to cover and another scampered single
the yorker is squeezed, via an inside edge, down to fine leg
Broad falls on the last ball, not sure he timed a single delivery that innings. Here he tries to work to leg and a leading edge finds cover

inn2.comm: bit of away nip from a length finds an outside edge that zips down to third man
this angles across the left-hander and slides off the face past a diving point fielder

what a slice of luck for Anderson, shoved a length ball down the leg side but Dilshan's flick flew down to Bresnan who ran in to take the catch. So both captains depart to leg-side strangles, different styles admittedly
close call for Jayawardene! Jayasuriya pushed an away swinger to cover where Pietersen pulled off an excellent stop and had his throw hit, Jayawardene would have gone
good conditions to bowl, this. Ball zipping away and Jayawardene leaving
very crisply steered to third man to end an eventful first over
poor start from him, bustling to the crease and hurling one way down the leg side
not the slower one by any means, but swing away from the bat deceived Jayawardene and he was too early into the drive. Fortunately for him, it dropped well short of mid-off
angled in towards the pads, Jayawardene nudges down to fine leg
Jayasuriya walks into a watchful drive, the point fielder fumbling the stop but not enough to give away a single

he's gone! The shot that brought him so many of his 13,430 runs in one-day cricket - a scything cut - but this time it's gone straight into the hands of Morgan at point. No grand finish for Sanath, but he leaves the field to warm applause from the large crowd. Goodbye to a Sri Lankan legend.
speared down the leg side by Bresnan, who is not quite at his metronomic best
that's more like it, aimed at the top of off and Sangakkara defends to point
and same again from Bresnan, landing one in the channel on off stump
curving away outside off, Jayawardene chops to point
this one goes down dead straight on off stump and Jaywardene defends back down the track
a touch of seam movement back in this time, but it's much too short and Jayawardene swivels to pull down to fine leg. They run two ... or rather, they don't as Billy Bowden signals one short
Jayawardene gives himself some room and flashes a top-edged cut down to third man, the ball bouncing a couple of metres in front of the fielder
massive, emotive appeal from Anderson as Sangakkara is pinged on the pad. Sahil and Miller both immediately raise the finger, but Billy says no and rightfully so, that's pitched outside leg
slightly leg side once again, but the clip goes straight to midwicket
Jayawardene shuffles across to get inside the line, nudging off the hip down to fine leg
nice line and length from Bresnan, and Sangakkara taps gently to off
good length, on off stump. Typical Bresnan stuff and Sangakkara can only defend
great riposte from Kumar, he's not going to let Bresnan just run up and hit a length, he walks out and across to off, lifting the ball up and over midwicket
punched to cover on the up, and this should have been run out! Total confusion out in the middle, and while Sangakkara and Jayawardene discuss things mid-pitch KP fires in a shy, but misses!
nudged quietly to leg to end the over
there's not been quite as much swing for Anderson as might have been expected in these conditions, this one going gently off the seam and defended

there's some swing! This might be the fullest ball Anderson has bowled today, and it's wobbled appreciably back in to beat the inside edge and ping Jayawardene's left pad ... the finger goes up, that's out!
a nervous leading edge to start Kandamby's innings, but it falls safely on the off side
Kandamby off the mark with a tickle to leg

there goes another one! Full again from Anderson, a touch of swing and Sangakkara is too early into a straight drive, popping the ball straight back to the bowler, who holds the catch in his follow through. Two wickets in the over for Anderson, and Sri Lanka are tottering now.
shaping away outside off, Mathews gets across and leaves well alone
Bresnan keeps Kandamby deep in his crease with a good length delivery that is defended towards point
slightly straighter, Kandamby looks to nudge to leg but picks out the fielder
angled across the left-hander and going even further off the seam, Kandamby guides down to gully
short and very wide, Kandamby throws the bat out but can't get to it. Rightly called wide
Bresnan is settling into a good rhythm now, again hitting a length that Kandamby has to defend
same again, Bresnan aiming at the top of off and Kandamby defending with a hop
slightly straighter this time, but Kandamby doesn't try anything expansive - he can't really afford to now - and the ball trickles to midwicket
just short of a good length, but it keeps Mathews back in his crease as he defends and doesn't cost any runs
Jimmy sends one down on a much fuller, attacking length but Mathews defends with equal skill, bat and pad right together
shot! Good counter-attacking stuff from Mathews, who came down the pitch to upset the bowler's length but didn't over-hit it, just driving powerfully through the line to pick up four down the ground
Anderson responds with a ballooning bouncer the leaps well over Mathews' head
short again, although not the attempted bouncer this time, and a paddle-pull gets Mathews one
full and straight, Kandamby flicks to midwicket
atrocious calling out in the middle! Tapped to Pietersen and they just set off without looking at each other. The batsman wasn't even in the frame, but KP has missed again!
the ball takes the inside edge and bounces off the pad, no run to be had

short, Kandamby pulls but the ball comes off the splice and loops to Trott! But wait, there's no celebration from Bresnan, and in fact this may not have carried. Trott suggested straight away that he didn't know, and the umpires are going to have another look. Yep, that's bounced just in front of him.
nope, full outside off and Kandamby comes forward to tap to cover
there's the short ball, on off stump. Kandamby sways out of the away and attempts to ramp it up and over the keeper, but misses
fuller and straighter, nudged out on the leg side
and now Mathews gets the bumper, and has to hurry to get underneath it
length to start, rising outside off. Kandamby stands back and slices a cut down to third man
jammed down just back of a length at good pace, Mathews defends
flicked deftly off the hip down to fine leg, where Bresnan has some work to do to stop the boundary
short on off stump, Kandamby gets his head out of the way and thinks about another upper-cut
glanced off a middle stump line out to midwicket
short on middle, Mathews gets up on one leg and pulls out to midwicket. Not quite out of the middle, but a confident-looking shot
Mathews looks to attack straight away, but almost pays the price! He jumped out of his crease and slashed hard, a top edge flying down to third man but dropping short of Broad
full and straight, Kandamby whips neatly out to midwicket
already the slower ball from Dernbach, and it's a good one. The ball comes out of the back of the hand, leaving the bat off the pitch and beating the outside edge
another sloiwer one, this time it's straighter and Mathews defends
Dernbach bends his back in this delivery, finding good pace but sending the ball down the leg side
slower ball again, but this one is picked by Mathews, who shuffles across to off and tickles the ball to the fine leg boundary
full of length on off stump, Kandamby defends
nicely full again from Broad, attacking the stumps. Kandamby flicks to leg but can't beat the field
sharp bouncer! That was spicy, and drew a gasp of approval from the spectators. Kandamby had to move very swiftly to protect his throat there ...
and he follows that up with a slower ball - an offcutter - that Kandamby doesn't pick. More a case of ball hitting bat
quick and just short of a good length on middle and leg, Kandamby nudges off the hip through square leg
great shot! The short ball won't intimidate Mathews, who gets inside the line and up on one leg again to send the ball racing to the fine leg boundary
full on off stump, Kandamby steps across and defends watchfully to cover
short of a good length outside off, Kandamby stands up to guide to third man for one

what a catch! Dernbach dug one in short and Mathews was quickly into the pull, but hit the ball in the air towards midwicket where Anderson went airborne, leaping to his right to complete the dismissal. Dernbach's first wicket in ODIs, and it's snapped what was just beginning to turn into a fightback from Sri Lanka
angling across the left-handed Mendis, who leaves alone
the ball touches something on the way through, and is finally held by a juggling Kieswetter ... but that's hit the pad and nothing else
tucked off the pad to long leg to get off the mark
Mendis looks a decent batsman, hopping across to off to pick up another single through square leg
Mendis stands tall to ride the bounce and drops the ball towards point, there's no single to be had
much fuller from Broad, Mendis angles the bat to try and get the ball through gully but backward point stops the single
on the pads, but clipped straight to the fielder
nice shot. Kandamby has had a look at this shot a few times, and this time he's nailed it, upper-cutting down to the third man boundary
this time Kandamby gives himself some room, but the ball zips past his swishing cut shot
back-of-the-hand slower ball, right on the toes, and it's dug out into the leg side
quicker one this time, and the ball buzzes past the outside edge of Kandamby's drive
Kandamby walks across and jabs a square drive down to wide third man
a lifter outside off, Mendis sways out of the way
pushed out on the off side, they sprint through for one
another slower ball, this one quite wide outside off and Kandamby is beaten
twirled down on middle, defended to leg
nudged defensively into the covers, and they steal a single to bring up the 50

Swann is on his knees pleading for Billy Bowden to give this out! He comes round the wicket and hits the back pad ... one feels only an inside edge could save him, and indeed HotSpot indicates that is the case
whipped to square leg for a single
Mendis is a flurry of arms and legs as he attempts a wild reverse-slog, but misses completely
punched away for a single
starts back of a length, obviously, wide of off too and is slashed to third man
full! It was full and straight and calmly defended
Mendis flicks his wrists on a good-length delivery and it flies out to deep midwicket
sharp single taken as this thuds off the body onto the leg side
another short ball which Kandamby tries again to upper-cut. His success rate with that shot isn't special this innings
back to a good length to finish the over. Kandamby is stuck here
Mendis on the reverse sweep, lands it well but Bopara - on as a sub - fields smartly at short third man
more good work from Bopara as this is squeezed to third man
another one down. This is ending in a hurry. Mendis edges down the wicket and chips a catch to short midwicket. Very easy indeed
huge appeal from Kieswetter as this skims past the edge. He was appealing for a stumping
careful defence this time from Kulasekara
solid blocking to end the over
smacked without much timing towards mid-on but it arrives on the bounce
fuller delivery this time is bunted down the ground
if you believe the speed gun, Broad is flying these through at 92mph. Good line here too and blocked to cover
good off-stump line but it's a thick edge from the shortish length. Flies in the air through where a gully might be
touch too short again and a long way down leg
Kandamby's struggles continues as he flays and misses at a full toss outside off
stuttering defence this time
Swann gives it a bit of air and is pushed down to long-off
neatly played by Kandamby here, edging down the wicket and opening the face to square drive
carefully driven to cover
Kulasekara is all defence at the moment
not sure where this is going really. Kulasekara prods to leg with the required rate mounting
flipped around the corner but only for a single
starts full but down the leg side and it needs an excellent, tumbling save from Broad on the leg side boundary to save four from the flick
good bouncer this, straight onto the helmet, zipped up from a shortish length
and another bouncer, good one too. Kulasekara doesn't play it well, fending with high hands. Doesn't look comfortable at all
excellent work from Anderson. Two sharp short balls followed by a sucker full one, and with Kulasekara hanging back, he spoons it tamely to mid-on where Cook dives forward to take a good catch
Randiv works his first ball into the leg side, playing it rather well all things considered
play and a miss outside off stump to end an excellent over. Anderson is friends with the white ball again. For now. Also with 20 overs gone we have a match, in some sense
shortish ball to start with is wheeled away down to fine leg
"arrrgh" screams Bresnan as he shoves this down the leg side
back onto a good line as Randiv swings and misses
good length this time, fuller, Randiv gets into line to block
back of a length this time, but the line is sound and defence is the only option, apparently
Randiv ducks under a short ball
very quiet start to the Powerplay with Randiv unable to get anything away

Dernbach replaces Anderson and strikes straight away! Short ball rushes onto Kandamby and the pull shot gets high on the bat and loops to mid-on. Dernbach celebrates with a Freddie-style arms-aloft pose, make of that what you will
good wheels from Dernbach but it's called a wide. It was short and angling down the leg side
edged behind is it!? No. Think there was a  big outside edge there, which HotSpot confirms, from a shortish ball that was nicked behind. The umpire didn't hear it
this is worked into space on the leg side
Malinga gets off the mark with a boundary, top edging an enormous swipe over the keeper's head for four
another big heave from Malinga, but he didn't read the slower ball
another slower ball is missed but thuds off the pads down towards third man
Bresnan hustles onto a length around middle stump and Randiv has nowhere to go
top shot this, back-foot drive timed immensely through the covers
Bresnan's response is a slower ball, but the line is a touch wrong
worked into space for a single
full ball, yorker length, Malinga backs away and then can't reach it
Malinga reads the slower ball and clumps it straight back down the ground for four. He got all of that
four more! Despite a big dive from Kieswetter, it was sliced and flew very quickly to the keeper, who dropped the chance. Despite the intervention it still sped to the rope
Dernbach is back and finds a decent line and length, worked to third man
Malinga backs away a long way, Kieswetter style, and leaves it when it's outside off stump
this time Malinga stays in line and steers it to deep point
bouncer shoved down and Randiv is happy to tuck under
nicely done by Randiv, waited on a slower ball and crashed it over and wide of mid-off for four
another good shot, off the back foot this time, Randiv hanging leg side of the ball and punching a drive to deep point, Pietersen scoots round from third man to field
the Powerplay has ended so Swann is back starts by sliding this past Malinga's outside edge
this is driven down to long on
another play and miss outside off stump. No spin for Swann with the damp conditions
open-face steer towards point where Bopara fields
Malinga has seen enough! One foot down, big heave across the line and he's got plenty of it. Sends it two-rows deep into the stands at cow corner
tries to repeat the dose, doesn't time it as well this time and it reaches long-on on the bounce
ouch. Broad won't go full again after this! Malinga backs away and creams this through cover, rocketed to the fence
it was short, but a slower bouncer, and Malinga wheels it to midwicket
lovely drive from Randiv this time, punching the ball at the top of its bounce to the sweeper on the cover boundary
steered to point this time
short ball from Broad, Randiv stays leg side and helps it over point for a boundary
good delivery to finish the over. On a good length, moving away and driven without much timing to mid-off
Randiv works this into the leg side
swept hard around the corner
gone, finally. Malinga this time can't land one of his big leg-side clumps, instead a bit of drift finds a top edge that loops high towards point where Bopara holds the chance
Randiv slices a cut to point, the required rate just past 20, so England in with a chance
played and missed outside off stump
that's it! Kieswetter finishes things off with a swift stumping as Randiv gropes and misses outside off stump
